cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 45 mi NW of the Isle of Youth and 90 mi SW of Havana, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across the southeastern and central Gulf of Mexico, then turning north toward the southeast Louisiana coast – tracking directly toward the New Orleans area
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana coast (likely south of New Orleans between Intracoastal City and the Mouth of the Mississippi River)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Sabine Pass TX to Rockefeller Wildlife Refuge LA (Storm Surge Watch); Cameron LA to west of Intracoastal City LA and Mouth of Pearl River to MS/AL border (Hurricane Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Storm Surge Warning east of Rockefeller Wildlife Refuge LA to the MS/AL border, including Lake Borgne, Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas; Hurricane Warning Intracoastal City LA to Mouth of Pearl River, including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and Metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana through coastal Mississippi and Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane-force winds (possibly 100+ mph if Ida strengthens to a major hurricane) likely Sunday with tropical-storm-force winds beginning late Saturday night.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 4–7 ft possible in Lake Pontchartrain and along the southeast Louisiana coast near and east of the expected landfall point.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–16 inches with isolated totals to 20 inches, producing considerable flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands; life-threatening surf and rip currents; prolonged power outages and port infrastructure disruption.
